value.title: Azure fundamentals learning path
value.excerpt: Follow this learning path for a broad and compelling introduction to the fundamentals of Azure cloud computing.

topItems.title: Cloud Concepts - Principles of cloud computing
topItems.excerpt: Explore the core concepts of cloud computing and how it can help your business.

images.title: Cloud Concepts - Principles of cloud computing

topItems.title: Create an Azure account
topItems.excerpt: The first step to using Azure is to sign up. You may sign up directly through Azure.com, with the help of a Microsoft representative, or through a partner. If you’re new to Azure, you may sign up for an Azure free account to start exploring with $200 USD free credit and free services.

images.title: Create an Azure account

topItems.title: Core Cloud Services - Introduction to Azure
topItems.excerpt: Get started with Azure by creating and configuring your first website in the cloud.

images.title: Core Cloud Services - Introduction to Azure

topItems.title: Core Cloud Services - Azure architecture and service guarantees
topItems.excerpt: Azure provides a global network of secure datacenters you can deploy your services into. Learn about the physical architecture of Azure, how redundancy is provided, and what service guarantees Microsoft provides.

images.title: Core Cloud Services - Azure architecture and service guarantees
Cloud Concepts - Principles of cloud computing

value.title: Azure fundamentals
value.excerpt: Interested in the cloud, but aren't sure what it can do for you? This path is the place to start.

topItems.title: Cloud Concepts - Principles of cloud computing
topItems.excerpt: Explore the core concepts of cloud computing and how it can help your business.

value.title: Cloud Concepts - Principles of cloud computing
value.excerpt: Explore the core concepts of cloud computing and how it can help your business.

images.title: Cloud Concepts - Principles of cloud computing

value.title: Create an Azure account
value.excerpt: The first step to using Azure is to sign up. You may sign up directly through Azure.com, with the help of a Microsoft representative, or through a partner. If you’re new to Azure, you may sign up for an Azure free account to start exploring with $200 USD free credit and free services.

images.title: Create an Azure account

value.title: Store and share files in your application with Azure Files
value.excerpt: Azure Files provides a cloud-based file share for storing and sharing files to applications. Whether it's an application hosted in Azure App Service, an Azure VM, or an on-premises app, Azure Files can store and share file access between one or more applications and systems in a secure and failure-resilient manner.

images.title: Store and share files in your application with Azure Files

value.title: Create your first Azure IoT Central app
value.excerpt: This module builds an IoT Central app to monitor and command a refrigerated truck. The first unit creates the app, the second unit defines a device template for a refrigerated truck. Then, create a programming project, add code to simulate a truck, and communicate with your IoT Central app. The truck is monitored through a custom dashboard.

images.title: Create your first Azure IoT Central app

value.title: Core Cloud Services - Azure compute options
value.excerpt: Review the Azure compute services and explore how they can solve common business needs.

images.title: Core Cloud Services - Azure compute options

value.title: Implement resource management security in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to secure resources using policy, role-based access control, and other Azure services

topItems.title: Security, responsibility, and trust in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Discuss the basic concepts for protecting your infrastructure and data when you work in the cloud. Understand what responsibilities are yours and what Azure takes care of for you.

images.title: Security, responsibility, and trust in Azure

topItems.title: Apply and monitor infrastructure standards with Azure Policy
topItems.excerpt: Learn about governance and management in Azure services.

images.title: Apply and monitor infrastructure standards with Azure Policy

topItems.title: Control and organize Azure resources with Azure Resource Manager
topItems.excerpt: Use Azure Resource Manager to organize resources, enforce standards, and protect critical assets from deletion.

images.title: Control and organize Azure resources with Azure Resource Manager

topItems.title: Secure your Azure resources with role-based access control (RBAC)
topItems.excerpt: Learn how to use RBAC to manage access to resources in Azure.

images.title: Secure your Azure resources with role-based access control (RBAC)
Security, responsibility, and trust in Azure

value.excerpt: If you're an IT Administrator that's new to Azure and need to prepare for Exam AZ-104: Microsoft Azure Administrator, this path is the place to start. Learn the basic Azure concepts you'll need to know as an Azure administrator.

value.title: Predict costs and optimize spending for Azure
value.excerpt: Cost is one of the most important aspects of the cloud and can have a massive impact on your business. Azure has several tools available to help you get a better understanding of cloud spend and some best practices that you can leverage to help you save money.

images.title: Predict costs and optimize spending for Azure

value.title: AZ-400: Facilitate communication and collaboration
value.excerpt:
Learn how DevOps capabilities such as continuous planning and continuous collaboration help you communicate deployment and release information with business stakeholders.
Take this learning path to help prepare for Exam AZ-400: Designing and Implementing Microsoft DevOps Solutions.

topItems.title: Analyze DevOps Continuous Planning and Continuous Integration
topItems.excerpt: Explore the first two capabilities in the DevOps taxonomy, Continuous Planning and Continuous Integration.

images.title: Analyze DevOps Continuous Planning and Continuous Integration

topItems.title: Introduce the foundation pillars of DevOps: Culture and Lean Product
topItems.excerpt: DevOps is the union of people, process, and products to enable continuous delivery of value to our end users. Discover the first two foundation pillars of DevOps: Culture and Lean Product.

images.title: Introduce the foundation pillars of DevOps: Culture and Lean Product

topItems.title: Characterize DevOps Continuous Collaboration and Continuous Improvement
topItems.excerpt: Explore two capabilities in the DevOps taxonomy, Continuous Collaboration and Continuous Improvement.

images.title: Characterize DevOps Continuous Collaboration and Continuous Improvement

topItems.excerpt: Explore two capabilities in the DevOps taxonomy, Continuous Delivery and Continuous Quality.

images.title: Explain DevOps Continuous Delivery and Continuous Quality

value.title: Architect storage infrastructure in Azure learning path
value.excerpt: Learn how to architect storage solutions for your applications in Azure.

topItems.title: Choose a data storage approach in Azure
topItems.excerpt: Learn how using Azure Storage, Azure SQL Database, and Azure Cosmos DB - or a combination of them - for your business scenario is the best way to get the most performant solution.

images.title: Choose a data storage approach in Azure

topItems.title: Create an Azure Storage account
topItems.excerpt: Create an Azure Storage account with the correct options for your business needs.

images.title: Create an Azure Storage account

topItems.title: Upload, download, and manage data with Azure Storage Explorer
topItems.excerpt: Azure Storage Explorer allows you to quickly view all the storage services under your account. You can browse through, read, and edit data stored in those services through a user-friendly graphical interface.

images.title: Upload, download, and manage data with Azure Storage Explorer

topItems.title: Connect an app to Azure Storage
topItems.excerpt: Create a simple application and add configuration, client library references, and code to connect it to Azure Storage.

images.title: Connect an app to Azure Storage
Choose a data storage approach in Azure

value.title: AZ-104: Implement and manage storage in Azure
value.excerpt: Learn how to manage storage accounts, data in Azure Storage, and Azure File and Blob storage. This learning path helps prepare you for Exam AZ-104: Microsoft Azure Administrator.

topItems.title: Create an Azure Storage account
topItems.excerpt: Create an Azure Storage account with the correct options for your business needs.

images.title: Create an Azure Storage account

topItems.title: Choose the right disk storage for your virtual machine workload
topItems.excerpt: Azure provides a variety of disk storage options for virtual machine workloads. Identify the features of capabilities of each type to ensure your application performs optimally.

images.title: Choose the right disk storage for your virtual machine workload

topItems.title: Secure your Azure Storage account
topItems.excerpt: Learn how Azure Storage provides multilayered security to protect your data. Find out how to use access keys, to secure networks, and to use Advanced Threat Protection to proactively monitor your system.

images.title: Secure your Azure Storage account

topItems.title: Store and share files in your application with Azure Files
topItems.excerpt: Azure Files provides a cloud-based file share for storing and sharing files to applications. Whether it's an application hosted in Azure App Service, an Azure VM, or an on-premises app, Azure Files can store and share file access between one or more applications and systems in a secure and failure-resilient manner.

images.title: Store and share files in your application with Azure Files
